definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: Inspired by the famous 2D drawing of the optical illusive bookshelf.
sentences.chinese: 受著名的2D視錯覺繪圖啓發而設計的書架。

sentences.english: This article is mainly focus on the application of the color illusion within graphic design.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要研究色彩視錯覺在平面設計中的應用。

sentences.english: Sloping walls on the bulk of the building create an optical illusion.
sentences.chinese: 大樓主體的斜牆給人造成一種視錯覺。

sentences.english: The filter has been used to test and analyse Kanizsa triangle.
sentences.chinese: 並用該濾波器對視錯覺三角進行了分析。

sentences.english: What you had seen couldn't be true, it might be a fallacy of the eye.
sentences.chinese: 你所看到的不可能是真的，也許是你的視錯覺。

sentences.english: And then focuses on optical illusion in the use of landscape design.
sentences.chinese: 然後再重點論述視錯覺在景觀空間設計中的運用。

sentences.english: It's an optical illusion caused by the weak light.
sentences.chinese: 這是由微弱光線引起的視錯覺。
